contextId.information: The two occurrences of "everyone" are exaggerations, used to emphasize that the problem is serious. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_hyperbole]])

This is an exaggeration to show that these things were not the most important to God. AT: "animals burned on the altar and other offerings for our sins are not what you require most" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_hyperbole]])
contextId.quote: you have not required burnt offerings or sin offerings

contextId.information: The phrase "all day long" is an exaggeration to emphasize that their people are being killed frequently. This can be stated in active form. AT: "people are killing us all the time" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_hyperbole]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: we are being killed all day long

contextId.information: There were more birds than anyone could count. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_hyperbole]])
contextId.quote: like dust ... as numerous as the sands of the sea

contextId.information: Here "touch" means to harm, it's an exaggeration Yahweh used to strengthen his warning to not harm his people. AT: "Do not harm the people I have anointed" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_hyperbole]])
contextId.quote: Do not touch my anointed ones

contextId.information: Possible meanings are 1) all people who are alive are to praise God or 2) all creation that is alive is to praise God. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_hyperbole]])
